### User:
in a javascript web app, how do you save text to a local file

### Response:


Sure! To write the content of your JavaScript code into a local file using Node.js and fs module in NodeJS, follow these steps - 

1) Firstly, install node by following this link https://nodejs.org/en/. 
2) Once installed successfully, open up command prompt or terminal on windows machine
3) Navigate to the directory where you want your text file saved (using cd <directory_path>) and type "touch <filename>" in order to create a new empty file with name 'filename'. For example: if I wanted my local file named as test.txt, then i would navigate using command prompt or terminal like this -
```bash
cd C:\Users\username\Documents
touch test.txt
```

4) Once the file is created successfully, open it in your preferred text editor (I recommend Visual Studio Code). 
5) Inside of VSCode, create a new JavaScript file and start writing code inside using any syntax you like. For example: 
```javascript
let message = "Hello World!"; // This will be written into the local test.txt file when we run our app later on.
fs.writeFile('test.txt',message,(err) => {
  if(err){
    console.log("An error occurred while writing to file.");
  } else{
      console.log("Message was successfully saved!");
  }
});  // This will write the message variable into our local test.txt file using fs module in NodeJS. 
 ```

6) Save your JavaScript code and run it by typing "node <filename>" (without quotes). For example: if my filename is app.js, then i would navigate to directory where I have saved that JS file and type this command -
```bash 
cd C:\Users\username\Documents\app.js
node app.js // This will run the JavaScript code inside of our local test.txt file using fs module in NodeJS.  
```

7) If everything is working fine, you should see a message "Message was successfully saved!" printed on your console and also check if there's any content written into 'test.txt' file or not!
